title: Timothy B. Ruel
text:
Inquisitive data scientist interested in using my statistical expertise to build models, make predictions, and solve real-world problems with data. Experienced in using R and Python for data wrangling and machine learning.
Currently I am a fifth year PhD candidate in the Department of Statistics and Data Science at Northwestern University. My research involves developing a novel algorithm for the numerical approximation of integrated likelihood functions as a means of eliminating nuisance parameters from a statistical model.

title: The ‘generalizeR’ R package
text:
The ‘generalizeR’ R package
 
 
 
 


The ‘generalizeR’ R package




 
The ‘generalizeR’ is an R package implementation of the webtool thegeneralizer.org. Its purpose is to guide primary and secondary education researchers (K-12) through the process of (1) designing a sample recruitment plan with generalization in mind and (2) reporting where the results of a study may (or may not) generalize well.
